enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Medill Sophmores & Juniors
title: JOUR JOUR 301-0-22 Journalism in Practice
topic: The Obama's Chicago, A Tale of Two Cities

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Taught by Prof. Ava Greenwell
Journalism in Practice: Social Change and Urban Dynamics - From the regal homes of the Kenwood neighborhood where the Obamas own a home to the blighted Roseland neighborhood where President Obama worked as a community activist, Chicago is a tale of two cities. The re-gentrifying Hyde Park neighborhood is well known as the place where The Obamas worked, relaxed and went to school before their move to the White House. The neighboring communities, however, struggle to achieve the same positive notoriety. With the next presidential library to be built near the Obamas' old neighborhood, what will the global attention mean for nearby residents? The class will focus on reporting on social inequities impacting Chicago's South Side communities.?

subject: JOUR
